intro: Campanula polessica, commonly known as the Polish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Europe. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Campanula polessica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
